column2: So who\xc2\x92s idea was it to put everybody in the diner on skates?'
Oh, some idiot customer put a suggestion in the suggestion box.'
Oh my God, they took my idea!'
That was you?!'
Yeah! Okay, here you go. (rolls her back to Rachel)'
(bringing Rachel a mug) Rachel, I made you a cocoa. '
Oh my God, are you guys okay?'
Are you all right?'
(leaving Central Perk and seeing Monica laying on top of Rachel who is\nmoaning in pain.) Oh my.'
(sporting a goatee) Hey.'
Hey. Y'know with that goatee you kinda look like Satan."

Oh, so that\xc2\x92s why the priest threw holy water on me.
(there\xc2\x92s no reaction from Joey) Okay, listen, you have to cheer up! Okay? You
should come out with Ross and me, I mean anything is better than sitting around here
crying all day about Kate.'
Hey I was crying because, because nobody believed Quincy\xc2\x92s theory.\nOkay?'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey.'
(triumphantly) I\xc2\x92m gonna be on TV!!'
No way!'
Yeah! They\xc2\x92re putting together this panel to talk about these fossils\nthey just found in Peru and The Discovery Channel\xc2\x92s gonna film it!'
Oh my God! Who\xc2\x92s gonna watch that?!'
Thanks. You ready to go?'
Yeah. (they start to leave)'
Saw a girl with that vest.'
Thanks. (He takes off the vest and throws it on the floor.)'

(on TV) While most of us think of chocolate bunnies and baskets as
traditional Easter gifts. Some people insist on giving live chicks as presents. (Joey is
intrigued by the idea) Unfortunately, the sad fact remains that most of these little guys
won\xc2\x92t live to see the fourth of July. (Joey starts to call a place to buy a little
baby chick) Because of as a result of improper care, they will be dead.'
(on phone) Yeah, hi. You guys got any of those baby chicks? \xc2\x91Cause I\nwas watching this ah, commercial on TV and man, those guys are cute!'
Hi!'
Hi! Hey, Pete you\xc2\x92re back! Hey, check this out. (She starts to\nskate over to him)'
Wow! Skates! '
Wow! You\xc2\x92re a lot sturdier that Chandler. He crumpled like a piece\nof paper. So how was you\xc2\x92re trip?'
Well... (he holds up a gift he brought her)'
Oh, what\xc2\x92d ya bring me?! (She opens the gift) Awww, hotel\ntoiletries from Japan. Oh, these are gonna go in my permanent collection. You want some\ncoffee?'
Yeah, sure, that\xc2\x92d be great.'
(popping back up) Regular or decaf?'
Ah, which ever is closest. '
Okay. (hands him a cup)'
So ask me what I did today.'
So what did you do today Pete?'
I bought a restaurant and I would like you to be the head chef.'
What?! Oh.(She turns around quickly and falls)'
Can you believe he just offered me a restaurant?'
What a jerk! You want me to kick his ass?'

I mean this has been like my dream since I got my first Easy Bake Oven
and opened Easy Monica\xc2\x92s Bakery. I mean I would kill for this job. I mean I can
totally do this job, and God knows I paid my dues. (She removes her fake breasts) But
Pete\xc2\x92s just doing this because he has a crush on me.'
And you\xc2\x92re still not attracted to him at all?'
Hmm, no. I mean how can I accept a restaurant from him? I-I-I-I\ncan\xc2\x92t. I couldn\xc2\x92t even accept a necklace from Stu Vincent in the seventh grade.'
Yeah, but Mon that\xc2\x92s totally different. He was you\xc2\x92re health\nteacher.'
Oh, please. '
What? Honey.'
Oh, I am, my side still hurts from when you crashed into me yesterday.'
Oh God, I\xc2\x92m so sorry.'
I know. '
Ow!!'
Oh God!'
(entering, wearing a white suit with a little red bow tie) Hey, you guys!\nGuess what?'
(looking at the outfit) Got a job on a river boat?'
Y'know what I didn\xc2\x92t wear this suit for a year because you hated it.\nWell, guess what? You\xc2\x92re not my girlfriend anymore so..."
Oh I see, so this suit is making a point.'
Right.'
Now that you\xc2\x92re on you\xc2\x92re own, you\xc2\x92re free to look as\nstupid as you like.'
(to Monica) You like it right?'
Oh absolutely. I like it even more on you than I did on Colonel Sanders.\n(Ross starts to leave) Ross! Ross! I\xc2\x92m kidding!'
Yeah, come here!'
What-what was it you were gonna tell us? '
Yeah. Oh! Was how you invented the cotton gin?!'
Okay, good bye! (leaves)'
So um, after you put the suggestion in the box, how long did it take\nfor the roller skating thing to happen.'
Umm, oh, about three months.'
Okay, so I guess that\xc2\x92s about ah, two weeks before the topless\nthing kicks in.'
(entering carrying a box) Hey!!'
Hey!'
I got you something! Open it! Open it!'
Okay. (He opens it and it\xc2\x92s a baby chick) It\xc2\x92s a chicken.'
It\xc2\x92s cute, huh?'
Whoa-whoa-whoa, you guys, do you know anything about chicks?'
Fowl? No. Women? Nooo.'
Okay, well they are a huge responsibility, especially at this age. They\nrequire constant care. They-they need just the right food, and lot\xc2\x92s and lot\xc2\x92s\nof love.'
Oh, well no problem there. (He picks up the chick, hugs it really tight,\nand talks to it like it\xc2\x92s a little baby.)'
Easy Lenny.'
So? I mean have you thought about it?'
Okay. Here\xc2\x92s the thing.'
Oh no, not the thing. I hate the thing. What\xc2\x92s the thing?'
I can\xc2\x92t do it. I\xc2\x92m sorry, I wish I could, but umm, see you\nhave these feelings for me....'
Wait, wait, wait, wait, that\xc2\x92s-that\xc2\x92s what you\xc2\x92re worried\nabout? If that\xc2\x92s the problem, we\xc2\x92ve got no problem.'
Huh?'
No! Look, I was gonna tell you this over dinner, but I met somebody else.\nOn my trip.'
Oh?'

Her name\xc2\x92s Ann, she\xc2\x92s a journalist. Ahh, we met on the plane.\nShe asked me if she could finish off my peanuts, I thought she said something else, we had\na big laugh. Yeah, I just, I mean I got, I got tired of waiting.'
Oh, that\xc2\x92s great! I mean I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m sorry, but I\xc2\x92m so\nhappy for you. And now I can work for you!'
I guess you can.'
Oh my God! Oh, this is incredible! Ohh! (she rolls over and kisses him\non the cheek) All right, y'know what? I\xc2\x92m just gonna roll right into that office\nand-and quit!"
All right.'
Okay. (she gets ready to go) Can you give me a little push?'
Yeah, sure. Good luck!'

(rolling towards the office) I\xc2\x92m quitting!! Woo-hoo! (She rolls\nthrough a doorway and out of sight. We then hear a big crash, and see Monica roll past the\ndoor the other way.) I\xc2\x92m okay!! I\xc2\x92m all right!!'
(to Pete) Wow! That\xc2\x92s exciting, you went to Japan, made up a woman.'
What?'
I\xc2\x92m just saying, this woman, I mean she\xc2\x92s fictitious. No?'
Why would you say that?'

\xc2\x91Cause you\xc2\x92re still into Monica. So you told her there was\nsomebody else so she would agree to work with you, so \xc2\x91cause you figure oh if you\nspent a lot of time together, maybe something might happen, and...'
You\xc2\x92re good. You\xc2\x92re good!'
Yeah, no, I\xc2\x92m fairly intuitive and psychic. It\xc2\x92s a substantial\ngift.'
Listen, can you promise me that you won\xc2\x92t tell her though?'
Absolutely, oh I promise. Tell her what?'
Thanks a lot.'
No I\xc2\x92m serious. I mean I\xc2\x92m intuitive, but my memory sucks.'
Okay, but this is the last time. (singing) With a chick-chick here,\nand a chick-chick there. Here a chick, there a chick, everywhere a chick-chick-(Joey\nenters)-chickeeeen.'
Hey.'
Hey.'
How\xc2\x92s she doing?'
She?'
Well yeah, don\xc2\x92t-don\xc2\x92t you think it\xc2\x92s a she?'
I don\xc2\x92t know. (He picks the chick up and turns it over, trying to\ndetermine the sex of the chick, and blows on it.) I can\xc2\x92t tell, what ever it was went\nback in too quickly.'
Well, anyway, I got to go change, I\xc2\x92m ah, meeting some of the cast\nfor drinks.'
Excuse me?'
What?'
I stayed home from work today while you were at rehearsal so somebody\ncould be here with our chick!'
Hey! Who was up from 2 o\xc2\x92clock this morning until 5 o\xc2\x92clock this\nmorning trying to get her back to sleep?'
You don\xc2\x92t think I get up when you get up?'
Ohhh, here it comes.'
Yes, here it comes! I\xc2\x92m stuck here all day, and then you come in\nand spend two seconds with us and then expect to go off gallivanting with your friends?\nWell I don\xc2\x92t think so mister!'
Hey!! I need to relax! Okay? I was working all day!'
And you don\xc2\x92t think taking care of our chick is work?'
That\xc2\x92s not what I said. Okay, I just meant...'
I know what you meant!! (pause) You notice that ever since we got this\nchick, we\xc2\x92ve been fighting a lot more than we used too?'
I don\xc2\x92t know, maybe we weren\xc2\x92t ready to have a chick.'
I\xc2\x92ll take her back tomorrow.'
Do you think we\xc2\x92ll get our three bucks back?'
(entering carrying a garment bag) Hey!'
Hey!'
(sees the chick) Ohhh, hey! All right, listen, I-I have that TV thing in\nlike two hours, and I need your help, okay? What do you think? (takes out two suits) This\nblue suit, or this brown one?'
Well, the brown one brings out your eyes, but your butt looks great in the\nblue one.'
Really? (Joey gives him a \xc2\x91Like I would know\xc2\x92 look)'
(she reaches for the bottle) Oww! (She grabs the bottle, but has trouble\nopening it. She pops the top off and aspirins fly all over the place as Ross enters.)'
Wow! That aspirin dance really works!'
(She bends over to try and pick up the aspirin) Oww!'
Oh my God, is that still...'
I\xc2\x92m fine, I\xc2\x92m fine.'
No you\xc2\x92re not.'
Yes I am! '
Rach!'
Look, I\xc2\x92m fine. Watch. (She picks up an aspirin between her toes)\nLook at that. (She lifts her leg to grab the aspirin with her hand and almost falls over.)\nWhoa-whoa!'
(stopping her from falling) Okay, okay. Look, you have got to go to a\ndoctor! Okay?'
No. I have got to get ready and go to a dinner at my bosses\nhouse. It\xc2\x92s a very big deal, there\xc2\x92s a lot of people there I have to meet.'

And I\xc2\x92m sure you\xc2\x92re gonna make a big impression. Hi! I\xc2\x92m
Rachel Green. It\xc2\x92s nice to meet you. (He lifts his leg and imitates shaking hands
with it, just like how Rachel was trying to pick up the aspirin with her feet.) Come on,
you probably have a broken rib!'
Well, I will go to the hospital tomorrow, it\xc2\x92ll still be broken\nthen.'
Rach...'
But y'know, I could use a hand getting ready."
Rachel...'
Look, either help me or go.'
Fine. I\xc2\x92ll go.'
(with a hurt expression on her face) Okay, but before you go, could you\nhelp me first?'
(He checks his watch) Sure. I\xc2\x92ll help you.'
(rushing in) Oh, good! Good! Do you guys know how to get a chick out\nof a VCR?!'
(She drops the brush) Y'know what? I cannot do this with my left hand!\nWould you please, help me with this too?"
Ohh. (He drops the shoes, takes the brush from her, and licks the tip. He\ndoesn\xc2\x92t like how it tastes.)'
(taking the brush back) Okay. Let\xc2\x92s use this brush. (Hands him\nanother one.)'
Okay. This stuff? '
Yeah.'
All right.'
Careful. Light. Okay, do you know how, just sweep it across the lid.\nOkay? Just sweep it.'
Oke-dokey. (He pokes her in the eye with the brush.)'
Oh-ho!'
Sorry.'
Hey! That\xc2\x92s just poking me in the eye!'
Sorry, I\xc2\x92m sorry. Close, close, close...'
Okay, just sweep it.'
I\xc2\x92m sweeping...'
Right.'
Sweep, sweep....(He starts to paint it on her eye, making it look like she\nhas a black eye.)'
Okay, now make it even, \xc2\x91cause we don\xc2\x92t...'
What? What?'
We don\xc2\x92t want it-it to be too much, we want it to be subtle.'
No. No, y'know you don\xc2\x92t, you don\xc2\x92t wear enough of this. (Rachel\nis shocked) What?"
Since when, since when do you think I don\xc2\x92t wear enough of this?'
Well I, close your eyes, I just think you\xc2\x92re gonna like this a little\nbetter, \xc2\x91cause, close-close... (He gets some more on the brush)'
Blow it.'
(blows it) Sorry. \xc2\x91Cause umm, I think this will make you a little\nmore sophisticated.'
Sophisticated like a hooker?'
Hey!'
Hey! '
Hey, guess what I\xc2\x92m doing tonight.'
What?'
I\xc2\x92m checking out the restaurant with Pete.'
Ohh, Monica, I am so excited for you.'
I know.'
Ooh, I have to tell you something.'
What?'
But I can\xc2\x92t tell you.'
Okay, but wouldn\xc2\x92t it be easier if you had to tell me something\nthat you could tell me.'
Well, sure in a perfect world. But, no, I promised I wouldn\xc2\x92t tell,\nand I swore to like all my gods.'
Okay. Does it have to do with Ross and Rachel?'
No.'
Does it have to do with Joey?'
No.'
Does it have to do with-with Chandler and that sock that he keeps by his\nbed?'
No, but let\xc2\x92s come back to that later!'
There you go! Good enough for your party, huh?'
Sure.'
Yep?'
Sure, I\xc2\x92ll just sit next to the trans-sexual from purchasing.'
Okay, come on! All right, I gotta go! So good luck at the party. Okay?'
Oh wait, Ross, would you just stay and help me get dressed?'
(checks his watch) Sure, okay.'
Okay. Okay, great! Umm, okay, just turn around.'
What?'
I don\xc2\x92t want you to see me naked!'
Rachel, I\xc2\x92ve seen you naked a million times. I ate hot fudge off you\nnaked. Remember, I-I sucked that mini-marshmallow out of your belly button?'
Yeah, but that was different. Y\xc2\x92know? I mean, we were, we were\ngoing out then, now I think it\xc2\x92s weird.'
Rach, y'know I can see you naked any time I want."
What?'
All I have to do is close my eyes. See? (closes his eyes) Woo-hoo!!'
Ross! Stop that!'
Ah, I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
Come on! I don\xc2\x92t want you thinking of me like that any more!'
Ahh, sorry, nothing you can do about it. It\xc2\x92s one of my ah, rights as\nthe ex-boyfriend. (closes his eyes again) Oop, oh yeah!'
Stop it! Cut it out! Cut it out!'
Okay, okay, I\xc2\x92m sorry, it will never happen... (closes eyes) Uh-oh!\nWait a minute! Wait-wait, now there are a hundred of you and I\xc2\x92m the king. '
Rosss...'
Come on, would you grow up? It\xc2\x92s no big deal.'
All right. (She starts to take off her robe) Fine.'
Yowzah!!!'
O-kay!! See what you did, I\xc2\x92m gonna be doing it by myself now.\nOkay? '
Aww, come on.'
That\xc2\x92s it. (She crawls onto the bed) Ow!!! '
Oh my God!'
Oh-ow!'
All right.'
Ow!'
Look...'
Ow!'
Okay.'
Ow!'
Rach?'
Ow! Ow!'
Easy. Easy. You have to go to the hospital. Okay?'
Okay, I do. '
Okay.'
I really do.'
Okay, I\xc2\x92m gonna get your coat and then I\xc2\x92ll-I\xc2\x92ll put you in\na cab.'
Okay. Oh wait, wait-wait, you\xc2\x92re not gonna come with me?'
(He thinks about it) Of course I am. I just have to make a call.'
Okay.'
Okay? (goes into the living room)'
Thank you. (She goes to take off her make-up and screams in pain)\nOww!!!! God!'
(rushing back in) What?! I wh-, what\xc2\x92s wrong?'
I\xc2\x92m sorry, I just can\xc2\x92t go to the hospital lookin\xc2\x92 like\nthis.'
Does it involve travel?'
Noo!'
Does it involve clogs?'
Oh, wait, wait. Clogs, or claws?'
Clogs.'
No.'
Claws?!'
No.'
Okay, so it doesn\xc2\x92t involve Ross or Rachel or Chandler or Joey.\nBut, what about Pete?'
(Shaking her head yes) No!'
What is it?! What about Pete?'
I don\xc2\x92t know! (frantically points at Monica)'
Okay, I feel like I\xc2\x92m talking to Lassie. All right, Phoebe would\nyou just tell me!'
I can\xc2\x92t!!'
Okay, I gotta go. (gets up)'
I, but you\xc2\x92re so close! No!'
Okay, does it involve something to do with Pete\xc2\x92s computer company?'
Oh, just go. You\xc2\x92re never gonna get it!'
I know. See, yes. That\xc2\x92s Yasmine Bleeth, she\xc2\x92s a completely\ndifferent kind of chick. I love you both. But in very different ways.'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey!'
(sees he\xc2\x92s watching Baywatch) Ohhh. (sees he still has the\nchick) Ahh! What are you doing?! I thought you were gonna take her back to the store\ntoday.'
I did! But the store wouldn\xc2\x92t take her back! So then I took her\nto the shelter, and you know what I found out? '
If they can\xc2\x92t find a home for her, they kill her! And I\xc2\x92m\nnot gonna let that happen to little Yasmine!'
Okay, good, good, good, \xc2\x91cause, good, \xc2\x91cause I was kinda having\nsecond thoughts too. '
Okay. And it\xc2\x92s not just chicks y'know? It\xc2\x92s all kinds of\nother animals!"
That\xc2\x92s horrible! Well, you did the right thing man.'
Thanks, I\xc2\x92m glad you see it that way.'
Ohhh-hoo, funny story!'

I don\xc2\x92t believe this! Wow, look at this refrigerator! It\xc2\x92s\ngigantic! I mean I could live in this thing! I\xc2\x92d be cold, but I\xc2\x92m always cold.\nOh my God, look at these spider burners! I love spider burners.'
So you like it?'
Oh, it is sooo perfect. Thank you so much. (runs over and hugs him)'
Oh, you\xc2\x92re welcome. (He takes a deep breath)'
Did you just smell my hair?'
Nooo. Uh-huh, no way. What? No.'
Oh God.'
What?'
You still have feelings for me don\xc2\x92t you?'
Now, nooo! I\xc2\x92m just excited about the restaurant, that\xc2\x92s all.'
Pete.'
Okay, I love you. Is that so bad?'
No, it\xc2\x92s not bad. It\xc2\x92s not bad at all. It\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s\nreally nice.'
Look, the only who stands to get hurt is me. And I\xc2\x92m okay with that.'
You may be okay about getting hurt, but I am not okay with being the one\nwho hurts you. That\xc2\x92s why I can\xc2\x92t take this job.'
What?'
And well, we probably shouldn\xc2\x92t see each other anymore. I\xc2\x92m\nsorry.'
Okay, yeah. I mean... If that\xc2\x92s, if that\xc2\x92s really what you want,\nokay.'
Okay, bye. '
I\xc2\x92m sorry things didn\xc2\x92t work out...'
All right shut up for a second and let me just see something. (She\nkisses him back on the lips) Oh, wow! (They then hug and kiss, very passionately.)'
Okay, you\xc2\x92d tell me the truth. Right?'
Rach, you can\xc2\x92t look fat in an x-ray.'
Okay.'
Okay! Now you stay out here, and you think about what you did!!'
(to Chandler) That\xc2\x92s a duck.'
That\xc2\x92s a bad duck!!! (to Ross) How\xc2\x92d the thing go tonight,\nRoss?'
Oh, it was, nah, well....'
What thing? What thing?'
Nothing, ah there was this thing at the museum. Come on. (they go into her\napartment) Easy.'
(to the duck) Okay, now when you come back I hope you remember that,\nthat chick is not a toy! (He goes back into the apartment)'
What thing? What is this thing?'
I was kinda, supposed to be on TV tonight for The Discovery Channel.'
Oh my God! '
Yeah.'
Ross, why didn\xc2\x92t you tell me that?'
Eh, \xc2\x91cause I knew that if I told you, you\xc2\x92d make me go, and I\nknew you needed someone to be with you tonight. Come on. Come on.'
I cannot believe you.'
What?'
That is the sweetest thing, I just....'
(breaking the silence) You should get some sleep.'
Okay.'
So, I\xc2\x92ll umm...'
Oh, I\xc2\x92m sorry I spoiled you\xc2\x92re evening.'
No, that\xc2\x92s, no, as long as you\xc2\x92re okay. So I\xc2\x92ll ah,\nI\xc2\x92ll see you tomorrow.'
Um-hmm, yeah.'
(After he closes the door) See ya.'
(coming out of his apartment and seeing Ross) What did you do?'
What \xc2\x91cha doing?'
Having a swim.'
What about the chick?'
Chicks don\xc2\x92t swim.'
Are you sure?'
I don\xc2\x92t know. Should we try it?'
Sure.'
See, I told you they don\xc2\x92t swim. (He goes to take it out)'
(stopping him) Wait. Give him a minute.'
Noo! (takes him out) Oh, it\xc2\x92s okay, it\xc2\x92s okay, baby, baby,\nbaby.'
